alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 5:56AM EST until January 16 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the beaches, Albemarle, Croatan, Roanoke, and Pamlico Sounds, Kitty Hawk Bay, and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Monday. Minor soundside flooding will be possible first, starting tonight, with the potential for minor flooding shifting to oceanside locations Sunday night due to long period swell arriving from a coastal storm offshore. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Duck NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.5 ft, Moderate 6.0 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.8 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 2.8 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/12 PM 4.9 1.2 2.2 5 None 15/01 AM 5.5 1.8 2.5 5-6 Minor 15/01 PM 5.4 1.7 2.9 5-6 None 16/01 AM 5.7 2.0 2.6 5-6 Minor 16/02 PM 4.9 1.2 2.4 5-6 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
